Detailed Description

template<typename TypelistT>
class DSI::TVariant< TypelistT >

C union like container for C++ objects.

The TVariant is a kind of union for C++ objects. It can contain an object of at least two different types. Example:

 // create an emty variant
 TVariant<TYPELIST_2(int, double)> v;

 // variant now stores a double value
 v = 3.1415;

 // you may access the stored data with the accessor function.
 printf("%f\n", *(v.get<double>()));

 // accessing the data as int is an error here
 // v.get<int>() is 0 now

 // reset the variant to store an int value instead of the double. The double will be destructed in appropriate C++ manner.
 v = 42;

The TStaticVisitor helps using a TVariant in a object oriented context.

Member Function Documentation

const T * get (  )  const [inline]

Const accessor function.

Returns:
a pointer to the stored type. If a type is requested that is currently not stored in the variant, NULL is returned.

Accessor function.

Returns:
a pointer to the stored type. If a type is requested that is currently not stored in the variant, NULL is returned.
signed char getTypeId (  )  const [inline]

Get the internal identifier for the stored type.

Returns:
the internal type identifier (which corresponds to the position of the stored type within the typelist typedef + 1) or 0 if the variant is unset.
bool isEmpty (  )  const [inline]

Check if the variant is unset.

Returns:
true if the variant does not contain a value, else false.

void reset (  )  [inline]

Destruct the stored object (if any) and default construct a new one of given type T.

void reset ( InplacerT  arg  )  [inline]

Destruct the stored object (if any) and construct a new one from the given inplacer argument. Include the THBInplaceFactory.hpp header file in order to use the inplacing functionality:

 TVariant<int, CHBString> v;

 v = 42;                                                 // copy construct from int
 ...
 v.reset<CHBString>(inplace("Hallo Welt"));              // inplace construct: call constructor of CHBString
                                                         // with const char* argument.
 printf("Now: %s\n", v.get<CHBString>()->getBuffer());   // access the newly created string
void reset (  )  [inline]

Destruct the stored object (if any).
